intro: Navarretia heterodoxa, commonly known as the Sierra white vetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, white, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Navarretia heterodoxa has a short life cycle and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Its foliage is usually low-growing and covered in fine, hairy structures that help reduce water loss.
